column1: Senior Workday Compensation Business Systems Analyst
column13:
Overview: 
 
   Are you excited to join something revolutionary? Do you want to be part of something special? If you answered yes to both those questions, keep reading! Avalara is looking for an extraordinary talent to innovate, design, and scale our Workday Performance and Compensation related processes and systems serving both internal and external business partners. This hands-on technical role demands a strong analytical, data modeling and business analyst background. 
 Responsibilities: 
  **Must have 7+ years' of experience with Workday**
 
 
   Maintain and manage Core Compensation & Advanced Compensation and their related business processes, configurations (i.e. Compensation rules and eligibility, support and maintain Merit Cycle processes, Reporting), and key administrative features of Workday
   Troubleshoot issues and questions reported by the business related to Compensation
   Gather and document business requirements of new initiatives or changes to existing processes/procedures impacting Compensation
   Design, implement, test, and deploy business initiatives impacting Compensation modules as well as understanding downstream implications for recruiting and payroll systems
   Manage and support key technical initiatives to deploy additional Workday functionality on the application roadmap
   Evaluate new technological solutions and make recommendations to enhance Workforce user experience
   Develop appropriate documentation for architectural, design, technical, implementation and test activities.
  Qualifications: 
 
  A minimum of 8 years of relevant professional experience in supporting/implementing Compensation/Advanced Compensation applications in a corporate HRIS/IT role.
   Supported at least TWO end-to-end implementations of Workday Advanced Compensation OR Workday Compensation PRO Certified
   Understanding of the impacts to Compensation processes and data feeds to other internal and external applications related to the relevant processes
   Hands-on configuration experience of Workday Core HR, Security, Compensation, Advanced Compensation modules
   Functional knowledge of Workday Security, Reporting, Payroll modules
   Ability to create, deploy, and maintain Workday custom reports and dashboards
   Strong communication and interpersonal skills
   Ability to multi-task and comfortable providing end user support and functional trainings
 
 
 
   Preferred Qualifications:
 
 
   Experience with Workday technologies - Enterprise Interface Builder (EIB) Report Writer, Business Process Framework, Configurable Security, Calculated Fields
   Experience with Workday's Human Capital Management (HCM) suite - Benefits, Absences, Compensation, Payroll, Security, Recruiting and Time Tracking
 
 
   Experience with SOX principles and concepts
  About Avalara: 
 
   About Avalara:
   We���������re building cloud-based tax compliance solutions to handle every transaction in the world. Imagine every transaction you make ��������� every tank of gas, cup of coffee, or pair of med song, every sensor-to-sensor ping. Nearly every time you make a purchase, physical or digital, there���������s an accompanying unique and nuanced tax compliance calculation. The logic behind calculating taxes ��������� the rules, rates, and boundaries is a global, layered, three-dimensional mess of complexity, with compliance dictated by governments and applied by every business, every day.
 
 
 
   Avalara works with businesses of all sizes, all over the world ��������� from corner stores to gigantic global retailers ��������� to calculate tax accurately and automatically, at speeds measured in milliseconds. That���������s a massive technical challenge, in terms of scale, reliability, and complexity, and we do it better than anyone. That���������s why we���������re growing fast. Headquartered in Seattle, Avalara has offices across the U.S. and around the world, in Brazil, Canada, or employment without regard to race, colour, creed, religion, age, gender, national orientation, disability, sexual orientation, US Veteran status, or any other factor protected by law.

Responsibilities and Duties

������ Prepare reports on a daily/weekly/monthly basis

Business Decision Modeller
Using decision modelling and elicitation techniques, you evaluate the decision-making approach of an organization to develop a rigorous, formal model of their decision-making. You will bring together various types of decision making including advanced analytics, machine learning, AI, business rules and human judgment in a unified decision model. Your decision models will be used to increase visibility in decision-making, improve business outcomes and support decision automation.
You will work with some of the largest companies, helping them to understand and automate decision-making for various types of business problems. Your focus will be on directly improving business outcomes. You will be trained in Decision Management Solutions��������� Decisions First��������� methodology, an approach to decision modelling using the Decision Model and Notation (DMN) modelling standard. You will be expected to further the development of this methodology and an Modeller typically plays a crucial role in analysing and optimizing business processes.
Responsibilities may include:
1. Requirement Gathering: Collaborating with stakeholders to understand business needs and gather requirements for decision-making processes.
2. Decision Modelling: Creating models to represent and analyse decision logic, often using tools like decision tables or decision trees.
3. Data Analysis: Examining relevant data to support decision-making models and identifying patterns or trends.
4. Process Optimization: Identifying opportunities to improve business processes through effective decision modelling and analysis.
5. Documentation: Documenting decision models, requirements, and analysis findings for clear communication across teams.
6. Collaboration: Working closely with cross-functional teams, including IT, to ensure the integration of decision models into systems and processes.
7. Continuous Improvement: Evaluating and refining decision models based on feedback and changing business needs.
8. Communication: to end-users or stakeholders on understanding and implementing decision models.
9. Risk Assessment: Assessing potential risks associated with decision models and proposing mitigation strategies.
10. Continuous improvement: Keeping abreast of industry trends, technologies, and best practices related to decision modelling and business analysis.
Requirements:
������ Qualifications in Management Information Systems/Computer Science
������ Experience as a Business Process Modeler or similar role
������ Proficiency in using business object and process modelling tools (e.g. BPM tools, UML and Entity Relationship Diagrams). An understanding of business process modelling notations, particularly BPMN
������ An interest in, and or understanding of, project management techniques
������ Availability to work flexible hours to cater for different time zones
������ Time management and organisational skills
������ Good chinking and problem-solving abilities
������ Commercial awareness
������ Confidence working with complex data and systems
������ An understanding of how IT can be used to resolve problems
������ Banking experience - banking products, credit risk or credit risk origination experience is a plus

   Position summary
 
 
 
   The Evolent Data Operations team is currently looking for an experienced Data Analyst who possess the ability to transform and provide supportive guidance within a team setting. This role within the team dynamic requires the candidate to exude patience, diligence, and sharp focus to meet the expectations set forth by the responsibilities of the role. This position requikills as communication is critical to success of overall team performance in addition to individual performance. On the Data Operations team, we have a great team atmosphere in which we all work collaboratively together to accomplish our goals and/or tasks. There is no ���������I��������� type of mindset within the Data Operations team; collaboration is key to Data Ops meeting established SLA/OLAs and monitoring of several enterprise SOPs. We continually strive to create a fun and fostering environment in which every team member���������s opinion, thoughts and ideas are encouraged and welcomed.
 
 
 
   The Data Analyst individual will be working with several other teams and/or departments in the following, but not limited to, capacity: (1) remediating data issues pertaining to processes which require a coordinated effort between multiple teams (2) working on developing short/long term solutions pertaining to processes which may require optimization and/orsting other teams and/or departments to help operationalize tasks (e.g. defining procedures & creating SOPs) that may require additional support not currently present (4) communicating vital information with internal and external stakeholders related to daily operational tasks and/or status of monitored processes.
 
 
 
   The Data Analyst main responsibilities will include, but are not limited to, the following: (1) managing and working directly with onshore/offshore team(s) to remediate issues related to data issues encountered on a daily basis (2) independently and/or collaboratively completing supplemental projects outside of the expected responsibilities and/or operations to optimize and contribute to the continued growth of the organization (3) working on tasks, data issues or other initiatives related to both Data Operations and Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) focus areas (4) continually working with reporting manager to accomplish larger team initiatives and contribute to the team������rwards meeting such initiatives/goals (5) Maintaining SLA���������s on tickets and bringing it to resolution via working with different internal teams.
 
 
 
   From a technical perspective, this position entails routinely working with tools such as, but not limited to, the following: SQL Server Management Studio/SSIS/SSRS, SAS, Microsoft suite/tools (e.g. Excel, Word, PowerShell, Outlook, Teams), File/ETL workflow applications (e.g. ETL coordination tools and MoveIT File Monitor), Atlassian products (e.g. Confluence, JIRA), Bot (RPA ��������� Robot Process Automation) application, Windows Task Scheduler and several internal built applications etc.
 
 
 
   Overall, the ideal candidate is a strong critical thinker and problem solver, detail oriented, possesses as a strong work ethic, believes in team success prior to individual success and wants to be an active participant within a fun, loving, team atmosphere. Additionally, the individual is eager to learn about new processcurrent operations on a continued basis. Also, the ideal candidate continually pushes to develop their professional skill set (e.g. hard & soft skills) and has a strong analytic approach to make important business decisions regarding complex situations one may be encountered with in the work environment.

Analyst - Data Science
 
  At our company we are leveraging analytics and technology, as we invent for life on behalf of patients around the world. We are seeking those who have a passion for using data, analytics, and insights to drive decision making, that will allow us to tackle some of the world���������s greatest health threats.
 
  Within our commercial Insights, Analytics, and Data organization we are transforming to better power decision-making across our end-to-end commercialization process, from business development to late lifecycle management. As we endeavor, we are seeking a dynamic talent to be a Founder and serve in the role of Analyst - Data Science.
 
  This role involves working with our partners in different Therapeutic areas (e.g. Oncology, Vaccines, Chronic Care, etc.) and Domain areas (Market Access, pricing, etc.) across the organization to help create scalable and production-grade analytics solutions, ranging from data visualization and reporting to advanced statistic will be working with a scrum team comprising of data scientists, business analysts, subject matter experts, data engineers, and business partners to deliver well-defined projects across therapeutic areas. This role is catered to a generalist and supports a wide range of possible tasks. These include descriptive statistics, supporting data visualization platforms, building out machine learning and advanced statistical models, which will sometimes be from scratch, and sometimes be from an existing prototype. This will involve understanding essential statistical and programming methods that ensure low bias models and parameterizing and modularizing code to support future model scalability and efficiency.
 
  Model development and deployment will occur in the cloud (AWS), and we���������ll look for the appropriate knowledge and/or experience. You don���������t have to be an expert in any of the potential areas of analytics, but need to be able to demonstrate aptitude, willingnindependently. We will have resources that you can leverage as needed. This role will require interfacing with executive and business stakeholders, so strong communication skills is a must.
 
  Who you are:
 
 
   You understand the foundations of statistics and machine learning and can work in high performance computing/cloud environments, with experience/knowledge in some aspects across statistical analysis, machine learning, model management, data engineering, data visualization, and data interpretation
  You are self-motivated, and have demonstrated abilities to think independently as a data scientist
  You structure your data science approach according to the necessary task, while appropriately applying the correct level of model complexity to the problem at hand
  Strong Python skills (some specifics of Sagemaker is a plus), and SQL skills are a must. Experience having deployed models to production is a plus.
  You have an agile mindset of continuous learning and will focus on integrating enterprise value into team culture
  You are kind, collaborative, and capable of seeking and giving candid feedback that effectively contributes to a more seamless day-to-day execution of tasks
  Ability to spin up quick visualization prototypes in PowerBI, Qliksense, or other similar tools is preferred. Experience with R-Shiny, Bokeh, Django, or JavaScript is a plus.
  You have an agile mindset of continuous learning and will focus on integrating enterprise value into team culture
  You are kind, collaborative, and capable of seeking and giving candid feedback that effectively contributes to a more seamless day-to-day execution of tasks
  Experience with real world data (e.g., claims, electronic health records) is a plus
  Experience within any of the therapeutic areas like oncology is a plus (e.g., NCCN guidelines, SEER data, understand lines of therapy rules, have knowledge about staging and existing therapeutic spaces)
 
 
  Education Requirements:
 
 
   Required: Bachelors degree with at least 0-2 years industry experience (experience requirement can be waived off for exceptional candidates
  Preferred: Advanced degree (MS, PhD) in a quantitative science or health field (e.g., computational biology, epidemiology, biostatistics, statistics, mathematics, physics, economics)
 
 
  Our Human Health Division maintains a ���������patient first, profits later��������� ideology. The organization is comprised of sales, marketing, market access, digital analytics and commercial professionals who are passionate about their role in bringing our medicines to our customers worldwide.
 
  We are proud to be a company that embraces the value of bringing diverse, talented, and committed people together. The fastest way to breakthrough innovation is when diverse ideas come together in an inclusive environment. We encourage our colleagues to respectfully challenge one another���������s thinking and approach problems collectively. We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to foster

All CVs / resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at our company without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of our company. column1: Staff Analyst - SAP MM, Logistics & GTS
column13:
About our group:
  
  
  
    Seagate is a global leader in data storage solutions engaged in the development, production, and distribution of data storage products and electronic data storage solutions. This group is part of our Global SAP Digital Transformation Initiative team at Pune, IN.
  
 
 
 
  
    About the role - you will:
  
  
  
   
     Conduct business workshops, gather requirements, design, and build SAP solutions independently through system configuration and customization, testing, and deployment of SAP Logistics, SAP GTS Process including Special Customs Procedures.
     Suggest solutions to customers based on SAP best business practices.
     Identify and resolve global trade business process integration issues with Sales and Distribution (Order to Billing), Material Management (PO to Invoicing) & Inbound & Outbound Logistics area by working with various business partners and stakeholders.
     Work closely with various SAP systems like SAP GTS, SAP S/4 Hana, TM, and non- SAP systems.
   
  
 
 
 
  
    About you:
  
  
  
   
     Ability to conduct business workshops, Fit-Gap analysis, Design and build SAP solutions by performing necessary SAP configuration and customization.
     Ability to write detailed Functional Specifications for the development of custom programs like enhancement and interfaces, reports and testing, and deployment of solutions to production system.
     Experience in Fiori Apps and their use and set-up.
     Working knowledge of EDI and IDoc functionality.
     Experience in working with global customers having operations in multiple countries.
     Proven ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment.
   
  
 
 
 
  
    Your experience includes:
  
  
  
   
     Should have strong consulting and functional skills in Materials Management, Logistics (Inbound & Outbound), SAP GTS and SAP S/4 Hana.
     SAP experience with minimum 2 full end-to-end SAP global project implementation experience and production support.
     Good to have knowledge on SAP GTS functionalities:
     
       Customs Management; Special Customs Procedures, Inward processing Relief (IPR) and Bonded Warehouse.
       SAP Electronic Compliance reporting including Intrastat reporting.
       Knowledge or exposure to UK (local), China, Thailand and Singapore custom procedures, dealing with local customs, import and export processes would be beneficial.
     
   
  
 
 
 
  
    Location:
  
  
  
    Our site in Pune is dynamic, both in our cutting-edge, innovative work, as well as our vibrant on-site food, and athletic and personal development opportunities for our employees. You can enjoy breakfast, lunch, or dinner from one of four cafeterias in the park. Take a break from your workday and participate in one of our many walkathons or compete against your colleagues in carrom, chess and table tennis. Learn about a technical topic outside your area of expertise at one of our monthly Technical Speaker Series, or attend one of the frequent on-site cultural festivals, celebrations, and community volunteer opportunities.
   
    Location: Pune, Brandview, India Travel: None

Description
  
  
    The Big Data Analytics Advisor carries out activities that support the team in proving actionable insights through analyses of large structured and unstructured datasets from unrelated sources. Helping to ensure the delivery of future predictions based on previous data patterns to provide solutions to business problems and requirements. The Big Data Analytics Advisor assists the team in providing business decisions using data science and statistical analysis through the wide ranges of data available to them, ensuring scalability in order to deliver the Big Data strategy and achieve business objectives. Typically reports to the Big Data Analytics Manager.
    #_VOIS

    Follows related processes to deliver tasks to support monitoring and optimising performance of developed models by driving experiments, benchmarking, etc.;
    Supports interactions with stakeholders across the business and may offer basic advice;
    Performs other job-related duties or tasks defined by the supervisor or resulting from assigned agendas.
   
  
 
 
  
    Skills
  
  
   
     Data Modelling

     Data Analytics and Insights
   
   
     Data Management and Transformation
   
   
     AI - Deep and Machine Learning and AR

     Strategic Mindset

     Coding

     Communication

  As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we hire and develop the most passionate people in their field to help build a better working world.   The Opportunity: Analyst-AMI-TAX-TAX - ITTS - Transfer Pricing
  AMI :
  The Advanced Manufacturing, Mobility & Infrastructure (AMI) Industry Market contains the following industries: Aerospace and Defence, Chemicals, Infrastructure, Industrial Products, Automotive, and Transportation thatr business world on not only how goods and services are bought and sold, but also on how they are devised and created. AMI builds and shares resources across sectors facing common challenges and aims to drive more effective cross-sector collaboration while enabling greater resource-pooling and developing more cohesive market responses. AMI also presents an opportunity to link regional sector communities with a more robust, global priority sector infrastructure.
  TAX - ITTS - Transfer Pricing :
  Our globally connected tax professionals offer associated services across all tax disciplines to help the clients prosper in an era of rapid change. We combine our exceptional knowledge and experience with the people and technology platforms to equip clients in making better business decisions by bringing insights to the forefront. We help companies recognize the tax policies and tax laws of governments around the world to plan and comply accordingly. Our teams leverage transformative technologies to deliver strategy and execution, from tax and regulatory obligations to operations and workforce management, to reduce risk and drive sustainable value.
  EY has competencies in Business Tax Services, Global Compliance and Reporting, Global Law, Indirect Tax, International Tax and Transaction Services.
  Your key responsibilities
  Technical Excellence
  Your main objective is to help the Tax team deliver quality products using general tax knowledge gained from training or education and assistance from more experienced tax professionals. Contribute to the profitable growth by ensuring client engagements are executed in an efficient manner. Operational Excellence / Day to day responsibilities Ensure that the areas of work assigned are executed in accordance with the work programme and the firm's methodologies and guidance, and professional standards. Use electronic working papers, efficiently including various software applications and sources of knowledge in an appropriate manner to conduct research. Acquire and demonstrate competence in technical knowledge, and compliance process by keeping up to date on trends, developments and technical authorities and apply them to moderately complex situations. Analyze and convert data into a tax product (advisory/compliance) and ensure accuracy and timeliness of the product. Where applicable thoroughly check documents and make available for tax inspections in an appropriate manner. Demonstrate professionalism through a positive and cooperative attitude and by maintaining the confidential and proprietary nature of client relationships and related work products. Sensitive towards EY code of conduct, values and quality standards Contribute to the overall success of the team by developing a thorough understanding of EY methodologies and tools to enhance service delivery; keeping team members informed of work status; actively seeking assignments when unassigned; proactively seeking opportunities to provide tax services Candidates should be willing to travel* IT Savvy
  Qualification
 
  
    A graduate and/or post graduate degree, preferably MBA or PGDM
  
 
 
  To qualify for the role, you must have
  Cleared both groups of IPCC
  Experience Relevant experience in TP or Tax is required
  What we look for
  People with the ability to work in a collaborative manner to provide services across multiple client departments while following the commercial and legal requirements. You will need a practical approach to solving issues and complex problems with the ability to deliver insightful and practical solutions. We look for people who are agile, curious, mindful and able to sustain postivie energy, while being adaptable and creative in their approach.
  What we offer
  With more than 200,000 clients, 300,000 people globally and 33,000 people in India, EY has become the strongest brand and the most attractive employer in our field, with market-leading growth over compete. Our people work side-by-side with market-leading entrepreneurs, game- changers, disruptors and visionaries. As an organisation, we are investing more time, technology and money, than ever before in skills and learning for our people. At EY, you will have a personalized Career Journey and also the chance to tap into the resources of our career frameworks to better know about your roles, skills and opportunities.
  EY is equally committed to being an inclusive employer and we strive to achieve the right balance for our people - enabling us to deliver excellent client service whilst allowing our people to build their career as well as focus on their wellbeing.
  If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.
  Join us in building a better working world. Apply now.

Build the future of data. Join the Snowflake team.
  
   The Security Solutions, Platform and Analytics team (SPA) builds custom solutions and provides engineering services that empower the Snowflake security team to bring the most secure Data Cloud to our customers and safeguard our organization's systems and data. 
   In this role, you will leverage your expertise in SQL, Python, and overall security domain knowledge to analyze security logs, event/threat data, and other business data to translate security requirements into effective technical solutions. With a focus on data analytics and engineering, you will develop advanced analytics techniques and build scalable solutions to identify patterns, anomalies, and trends in security data. 
   At Snowflake, we not only build tools that enhance the efficiency of security engineers, but we also believe in "drinking our own champagne." This means that we actively use our own products to strengthen our internal security practices. By utilizing our own tools, we validate their effectiveness, identify areas for improvement, and continuously enhance our commitment to security. Join our team and be part of an organization that not only delivers top-notch products to our customers but also embraces them internally to ensure the highest level of service across all fronts and workloads. 
   RESPONSIBILITIES: 
   
   
    Data Analytics and Engineering: Develop and optimize data pipelines, data models, and visualization dashboards. Collaborate with data engineering teams to ensure the availability, reliability, and accuracy of security data. Identify opportunities for data enrichment and implement strategies to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of security analytics processes.
    
   
    Solution Development: Collaborate cross-functionally with various security teams (Application Security, Threat Intelligence, Incident Response, etc.) to design and develop scalable and automated solutions that improve the effectiveness and efficiency of security programs.
    
   
    Security Business Context: Develop a deep understanding of Snowflake���������s security landscape, business objectives, and risk tolerance. Translate security requirements into technical solutions, ensuring that security analytics aligns with the security organization's strategic goals.
    
   
    Database Management: Take ownership of database management tasks, including data modeling, schema design, and performance optimization, specifically within Snowflake. Collaborate with cross-functional data/product teams to ensure data integrity, availability, and scalability. Utilize tools like DBT (Data Build Tool) to streamline data transformations, data pipeline orchestration, and data quality management.
    
   
    Research and Innovation: Stay updated on the latest advancements in security, analytics, threat intelligence, and emerging threats. Conduct researchapproaches to partner on enhancing the organization's security posture.
    
   
  MINIMUN QUALIFICATIONS: 
   
   Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Security, or a related field. Advanced degrees or relevant certifications are a plus. 
   9+ years of strong hands-on experience in SQL and Python, data analysis, and visualization. 
   Strong proficiency in SQL and Python, with hands-on experience in utilizing Python notebooks and Streamlit for data transformation, analysis, and visualization. 
   Good understanding of security principles, industry best practices, and emerging technologies. 
   Security domain knowledge, including experience with security information and event management (SIEM) systems, log management, and threat intelligence platforms. 
   Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to analyze complex security events and incidents. 
   Ability to articulate complex security concepts, findings, insights, and recommendations in an easily understandable manner to various stakeholders 
   Proactive and self-driven with the ability to work independently and prioritize multiple tasks effectively. 
   Continuous learning mindset and a passion for staying updated with the latest security trends and technologies.

Redaptive is seeking a detail-oriented and proactive HR Operations Analyst to join our dynamic team. This role involves overseeing various HR functions, ensuring smooth onboarding and offboarding processes, and addressing employee grievances. The successful candidate will play a crucial role in maintaining a positive employee experience and contributing to the overall success of our organization.
  
  
 
  
   Job Responsibilities

      Managing all verifications and documentation on HR Portal and various platforms
      Assisting the new joiner along with IT team for complete set-up
      Scheduling Orientation sessions and meetings with relevant teams
      Ensuring access to all necessary tools
      Administering Onboarding survey & work on action points to keep improving the Onboarding process.
      Benefits, Communication & Documentation: Send monthly reminders to employees regarding benefits and reimbursements. Ensure accurate data sharing with the payroll team for benefits inclusion. Issue Address Proof, employment proof letters to employees as and when required. Keep the intranet up to date with all relevant updates documents and policies.
      Performance Management: Support performance review process
      Engagement: Drive Engagement activities along with the HR team. Support HRBP during Engagement Surveys
      Offboarding: Manage end-to-end Offboarding by processing resignation acceptances and communicating next steps. Efficiently close the complete Offboarding by:
      Coordinating completion of necessary forms by departing employees
      Implementing payroll holds and scheduling exit interviews
      Removing employee access from various tools, platforms and directories
      Ensuring clearance by all functions and collection of all company assets
      Issuing experience and relieving letters on exit
      Special Projects: Collaborate with local and global team for planning and driving special projects
    
   
  
  
 
  
   Job Requirements /Qualifications 
   
    
     2-5 years of Human Resource experience.
      Familiarity with HRIS and payroll systems.
      In-depth knowledge of employment legislations and best practices with experience in managing complex employee relations issues.
      Proficient in Excel and Microsoft Office suite
      Flexibility and ability to manage multiple ongoing projects.
     
     
       Nice to have:
     
      Master���������s degree in Human Resource or related field.
      Familiarity with and a demonstrated ability to leverage AI technologies, such as ChatGPT, for various activities
     
     
       Behavioural Attribute
     
      Able to thrive in a startup environment and work with a high degree of autonomy.
      Strong communication skills and presentation skitude, willing, thoughtful, and proactive.
      Takes ownership and shows initiative.
      Excels in a fast-paced environment.
      Proactive and detail-oriented approach.
    
   
  
  
 
  
   About Redaptive Inc.
  
  
    Redaptive is an Energy-as-a-Service and technology provider that funds and installs energy-saving and energy-generating equipment. Redaptive���������s programs help organizations accelerate and scale efforts to reduce energy waste, optimize costs, increase resiliency, and meet sustainability goals across their entire real estate portfolio. With Redaptive, customers can quickly overcome capital and resource barriers to achieve energy-oriented benefits. Our proprietary best-in-class meters and data solutions validate and report on critical building information. Redaptive is backed by CarVal, ENGIE New Ventures, Linse Capital, CBRE, Evergy Ventures, Rabobank, CPP Investments, and Honeywell.
  
  
  
    Our company culture is fun, collaborative, and fast paced. We are pathe world and helping our customers to become more environmentally sustainable and profitable. We are looking for team members who are driven, passionate, and want to take on a diverse set of challenges to help grow a great company. Redaptive, Inc is an equal employment opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment. For more information, visit redaptive.com

Your work days are brighter here.
 
 
 
   At Workday, it all began with a conversation over breakfast. When our founders met at a sunny California diner, they came up with an idea to revolutionize the enterprise software market. And when we began to rise, one thing that really set us apart was our culture. A culture which was driven by our value of putting our people first. And ever since, the happiness, development, and contribution of every Workmate is central to who we are. Our Workmates believe a healthy employee-centric, collaborative culture is the essential mix of ingredients for success in business. That���������s why we look after our people, communities and the planet while still being profitable. Feel encouraged to shine, however that manifests: you don���������t need to hide who you are. You can feel the energy and the passion, it's what makes us unique. Inspired to make a brighter work day for all and transform with us to the next stage of our growth journey? righter work day here.
 
 
 
   About the Team
  We are Workday's Service Management Team! Our goal is to drive the effective and efficient operational delivery of the products and services offered by Business Technology. We design, develop and deploy intuitive solutions to help employees with their everyday service needs and our main focus is delivering value through automation and self service. We are excited to welcome new members to our team!
 
 
   About the Role
 
 
 
   Qualifications
 
 
 
  2+ years of experience with ServiceNow Admin / Developer with hands-on experience in Reporting and Dashboard.
  Well versed with creating reports and dashboards in ServiceNow
  Knowledge of performance analytics dashboards, KPIs and Metrics.
 
 
 
   Basic Qualifications
 
 
   Experience on reporting tools like Snowflake and Tableau will be an added advantage
   Setting overall reporting standards, frequency, and consistencies across various technology solutions
   Ability to partner with business analysts, consumers of the platform, and others to craft meaningful dashboards, reports, and builds analytical representation of the data
   Implements the governance surrounding all reporting.
   Makes recommendations to improve the use of reporting and analytics to drive outcomes
   Able to engage with Senior Management stakeholders to understand requirements and create performance analytics dashboards, KPIs and Metrics, Reports and Dashboards in Snowflake/Tableau
   Open to learn other reporting applications and deliver as needed
   Good understanding of the ServiceNow ITSM and Asset Management functionality to be able to explain trends from the reports/dashboards data
   Must be a Team player and should be able to work with minimal day to day supervision
 
 
 
   About You
 
 
 
   As a Software Application Engineer for Service Management Office Reporting, Analytics and Dashboard you will collaborate with business systems analysts and customers to design and deliver reports and dashboards on the ServiceNow platform. Using your knowledge of ServiceNow ITSM and IT Asset Management you will provide real time visibility into data and forecasts for effective decision making.
 
 
   Our Approach to Flexible Work
 
 
   With Flex Work, we���������re combining the best of both worlds: in-person time and remote. Our approach enables our teams to deepen connections, maintain a strong community, and do their best work. We know that flexibility can take shape in many ways, so rather than a number of required days in-office each week, we simply spend at least half (50%) of our time each quarter in the office or in the field with our customers, prospects, and partners (depending on role). This means you'll have the freedom to create a flexible schedule that caters to your business, team, and personal needs, while being intentional to make the most of time spent togeth"home office" roles also have the opportunity to come together in our offices for important moments that matter.
 
 
 
   Are you being referred to one of our roles? If so, ask your connection at Workday about our Employee Referral process!

Our Purpose

   Title and Summary
 
  Associate Analyst, Compliance Services
  OVERVIEW
  Global Compliance & Ethics provides expert compliance leadership to Mastercard. The Anti-Corruption team within Global Compliance has built a robust testing and molows the team to communicate how well Mastercard offices are performing against Mastercard standards and regulatory requirements.
  
  The Associate Analyst, Compliance Services role is located within Law & Policy and reports to the Manager, Law & Policy Services. The Associate Analyst will support Global Compliance & Ethics by
  1) performing tests of Compliance control effectiveness,
  2) following up on testing results,
  3) Review contract and agreements with Vendors / Clients
  4) Support on Special projects over and above the monitoring programs;
  5) support other areas like Business Conduct Office, Internal Audit, and Quality Assurance reviews
  
  
 
  Do you have experience performing detailed testing to ensure policies and procedures are being followed?
  Do you have a curious mind that will lead you to investigate to understand the root cause of issues uncovered in testing?
  Do you enjoy building informative reporting to help business owners manage their business?
 
  ROLE
  
 
  Perform detailed tests of Compliance controls based on documented testing steps to ensure Mastercard employees comply with policies, procedures, laws, and regulations
  Summarize and communicate results of testing in a timely, clear, and concise manner
  Apply critical thinking to interpret data and documentation to determine whether it adequately meets the policy and regulatory requirements, including documenting the rationale behind the decisions
  Summarize test results and data sets and incorporate results them into informative management reporting
  Communicate gaps and opportunities for improvement in testing and monitoring program so that the program is continuously improving
  Collaborate with internal business partners to identify problem solving solutions to challenges in executing testing program
 
  ALL ABOUT YOU
  
  EXPERIENCE
  
 
  2-3 years��������� experience performing detective tests, control tests, risk assessments particularly in an audit capacity (from Big 5 audit firms, MNCs)
  Compl & assessments in the financial services, banking or card payment industry preferred
 
  KNOWLEDGE/TECHNICAL SKILLS
  
 
  Strong Microsoft Office skills (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) required
  Experience with data analysis, Alteryx and Tableau is helpful
  CIA, CISA, CFE, or other relevant Compliance Certifications preferred, Law school candidates may refrain from applying for this position
  Familiarity with United States Foreign Corrupt Practices Act and the UK Bribery Act
  Fluency in additional languages preferred
 
  PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES
  
 
  Strong; business acumen, analytical, and problem solving skills, particularly resourcefulness in identifying solutions to problems
  Able to work in a team-based environment
  Able to follow and execute procedures with limited supervision, handle multiple tasks, and consistently meet established deadlines and SLAs
  Able to clearly summarize results verbally and in writing
  Able to juggle substantial competing demands and adapt to evolving priorities a must
  Able to work effectively with global partners in handling issues and questions
 
 
 
   Corporate Security Responsibility
 
 
   All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:
 
 
  
   
     Abide by Mastercard���������s security policies and practices;
   
  
   
     Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
   
  
   
     Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
   
  
   
     Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Ma

Company Description
  
  
    IntegriChain is the data and application backbone for market access departments of Life Sciences manufacturers. We deliver the data, the applications, and the business process infrastructure for patient access and therapy commercialization. More than 250 manufacturers rely on our ICyte Platform to orchestrate their commercial and government payer contracting, patient services, and distribution channels. ICyte is the first and only platform that unites the financial, operational, and commercial data sets required to support therapy access in the era of specialty and precision medicine. With ICyte, Life Sciences innovators can digitalize their market access operations, freeing up resources to focus on more data-driven decision support. With ICyte, Life Sciences innovators are digitalizing labor-intensive processes ��������� freeing up their best talent to identify and resolve coverage and availability hurdles and to manage pricing and forecasting complexity.
    Whiladelphia, PA (USA), with offices in: Ambler, PA (USA); Pune, India; and Medell������n, Colombia. For more information, visit www.integrichain.com, or follow us on Twitter @IntegriChain and LinkedIn.
  
 
 
  
    Job Description
  
  
    Your mission at IntegriChain:

Senior Specialist - Product Owner - IN
  The role act as liaisons between different stakeholders, including engineering, operations, and business to execute product strategy. They maintain and manage the product backlog, or the prioritized list of requirements for future product development.
  
  Key Responsibilities and Duties
 
   Incumbents in this role may also be responsible for modernization and integration efforts. 
   Product Owners work very closely with Product Managers to create user stories. 
   They author documents relating to product life cycle including product roadmap, business requirements and functional specifications. 
   They participate in sprint planning, perform market research and competitive analysis leading to the iterative development of the product.

   Job Description
 
 
   We are looking for a business analyst who has experience/understanding of Asset Management and has knowledge of data interface with external vendors such as FactSet and MSCI. Candidate will work closely with stakeholders, users, and IT to define business workflows as part of the team supporting various applications in Asset Management. Has good understanding of Equity, Fixed Income, Bank Loans, CLOs, Real Estate and Private Credit asset classes. The individual needs to be highly motivated, organized, self-starter with strong sense of professional pride and individual accountability.
 
 
 
   Key Responsibilities and Duties
 
 
   Performs analysis of business activities to determine business requirements. Works with business users to understand and define needs above and beyond requirements provided by the business.
   Converts business requirements into functional specifications that are understandable by technology team members.
   Design and document workflows, using existing workflows where applicable, that meet the needs of the business or minimize existing pain points.
   Work with Development teams to ensure existing application integrations are working as designed, including ensuing all data elements are being loaded properly.
   Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and the technology organization to ensure proper implementation of projects within the expected timelines.
   Ensure proper data processing using data checks and reports to facilitate error free business processes. Test any features that are released to production and make sure that requirements are met.
   Provides application and production support as needed to the departments and systems that they support.
 
 
 
   Required Skills:
 
 
   10+ years of experience in Finance domain with 5+ years of experience in Asset Management.
   Experience creating Business Requirements for Asset Management applications.
   Charles River Investment management system experience.
   Muni Trading related experience.
   Trading and compliance related experience.
   SQL experience.
   Proficient in analyzing data in MS Excel
 
 
 
   Preferred Skills:
 
 
   Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in a business or technology related field.
   Broad understanding of Equity, Fixed Income, Loans, Real Estate and Private Credit asset classes.
   Proven ability to efficiently communicate with others, both verbally and in writing.
   Proven analytical skills and a demonstrated ability to make independent decisions.
   Effective time management skills and can prioritize issues in a fast-paced environment.
   Ability to perform detailed analysis on existing systems at all phases of the project lifecycle.
   Experience working in an AGILE development environment.
   Experience in handling scrums.
   Experience in tools like Jira, confluence etc.
 
  Related Skills
  Continuous Integration & Deployment, Debugging, DevOps, Enterprise Application Integration, Problem Solving, Programming, Software Development, Software Development Life Cycle, Software Testing, Systems Design/Analysis, Systems Development Life Cycle

TIAA GBS India is focused on building a scalable and sustainable organization , with a focus on technology , operations and expanding into the shared services business space.

Job Description
 
 
 
   Specific responsibilities may include but are not limited to:
 
 
 
  
   
     Prepare and maintain marketing presentation materials: gather market data, portfolio characteristics, performance data, etc. to support product messaging across investment products
   
  
   
     Respond to ad hoc inquiries and requests for investment product views, portfolio attributes, and current positioning across products, as well as our firm���������s asset class views and outlooks
   
  
   
     Analyze and report on the competitive positioning of our investment products; help support our product development and commercial efforts
   
  
   
     Contribute to monthly portfolio performance commentaries and market outlooks. This involves an understanding of market events and investment products
   
  
   
     Attend relevant investment strategy meetings to stay current on investment strategies
   
  
   
     Actively seek ways to leverage technology for process improvements, pren, and automation
   
 
 
 
   Job Qualifications & Key Attributes
 
 
 
   The ideal candidate should have:
 
 
 
  
   
     Bachelor���������s Degree
   
  
   
     1-5 years of experience in the financial services industry
   
  
   
     Knowledge of and intellectually curious about finance and investing
   
  
   
     Must be very comfortable pulling and analyzing data from multiple systems and using data to drive sales and product positioning ideas
   
  
   
     Comfort working with many technology platforms, including a deep familiarity with Excel and PowerPoint. Experience with systems such as Morningstar Direct and Bloomberg a plus
   
  
   
     A team player with highly developed interpersonal skills, including collaboration, negotiation and consensus building. Highly motivated self-starter
   
  
   
     Ability to work effectively under pressure, adhering to tight deadlines and maintaining strategic relationships with internal partners
   
  
   
     Excellent communicatng skills, highly detail-oriented and organized
   
  
   
     Series 7 FINRA certification or willingness to obtain
   
  
   
     Current CFA or progressing towards preferred
   
  
   
     Creativity and a marketing ���������sense��������� is a distinct plus
   
 
 
 
   Client Group Overview
 
 
 
   The Client Group has a presence in the Americas, Europe, Asia and Australia, and is composed of five main areas:
 
 
 
  
   
     Sales & Client Services works with financial intermediaries and institutions to offer diversified investment solutions that help clients build and preserve their wealth
   
  
   
     Business Development is a conduit to the firm���������s investment teams and supports our clients and internal business partners through investment-platform and product content, messaging, competitive analysis and education
   
  
   
     Product Strategy & Development designs, develops and manages the firm���������s global ies
   
  
   
     Marketing promotes the firm and its services by creating, packaging and distributing content and messaging to engage diverse audiences through digital platforms and initiatives, strategic campaigns, and events
   
  
   
     Business Transformation looks to evolve and scale our business, leveraging digital and data, to drive top-line growth and improve profitability
   
 
 
 
   About AllianceBernstein
 
 
 
   AllianceBernstein (AB) is a leading global investment-management firm that offers high-quality research and diversified investment services to institutional investors, financial intermediaries and private-wealth clients in major global markets. Our client base includes some of the world���������s leading institutions as well as private-wealth clients and retail investors. We maintain research, portfolio-management, wealth-management and client-service offices around the world, reflecting our global capabilities and the needs of our clients. Partnering closely withnd portfolio management teams collaborate across asset classes, regions, sectors, and investment strategies to spark new thinking and deliver superior outcomes. We foster an inclusive environment that offers opportunities for team members to continually learn, develop their skills and take on new challenges to progress in their careers.
 
 
 
   We invest in our people and in the communities in which we operate, and we celebrate our diversity to showcase what makes us unique. We offer our talent the opportunity to grow professionally while working on cutting-edge ideas and outcomes in a global culture that operates as a tight-knit community.
 
 
 
   If you're ready to innovate and grow your career, join us.
  Pune, India

ICyte is the first and only platform that unites the financial, operational, and commercial data sets required to support therapy access in the era of specialty and precision medicine. Lattice Overview: 
 
   There is energy here���������energy you can feel crackling at any of our international locations. It���������s an energy generated by enthusiasm for our work, for our teams, for our results, and for our customers. Lattice is a worldwide community of engineers, designers, and manufacturing operations specialists in partnership with world-class sales, marketing, and support teams, who are developing programmable logic solutions that are changing the industry. Our focus is on R&D, product innovation, and customer service, and to that focus, we bring total commitment and a keenly sharp competitive personality.
 
 
 
   Energy feeds on energy. If you flourish in a fast paced, results-oriented environment, if you want to achieve individual success within a ���������team first��������� organization, and if you believe you can contribute and succeed in a demanding yet collegial atmosphere, then Lattice may well be just whata Analyst. The successful candidate will turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions. BI Data Analyst responsibilities include conducting full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities and design. BI Data Analysts will develop analysis and reporting capabilities. They will monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements. Analyze current business processes, gather complex business requirements, and prepare functional design to provide robust and scalable BI solutions.
 
 
 
   Duties & Responsibilities:
   
  
   Act as a SCM domain expert.
   Establish and foster strong relationships with colleagues in the Operations and Customer Service.
   Work on design and build solutions Oracle E-Business Suite and integrate with 3rd party systems.
   Embrace best practices in building Business requirements documentation and Functional Design documentation on business process flow.
   Support existing configurations and customizations in the Order Management, Logistics, and Manufacturing modules of Oracle E-Business Suite
   Assume responsibility for project tasks and ensure they are completed in a timely fashion.
  
 
 
 
   Job Requirements:
   
  
   BS or MS degree or equivalent experience relevant to functional area.
   10+ years of software engineering or related experience.
   8+ years of strong experience working on Oracle E-Business Suite
   Implementation experience with Oracle E-Business Suite modules Order Management, Manufacturing, Logistics
   Ability to develop and review complex solutions for P2P, OM, Inventory, Manufacturing flows.
   Involved in at least one full implementation cycle of SCM solutions with post-production support experience.
   Ability to think creatively and combine big-picture perspective with detailed, fact-based recommendations.
   Experience in working with Multi-National & Offshore / Onsite team.
   Analytical and detailed-oriented in approaching problem solving.
   Ability to work effectively with Cross-functional teams. 
   Ability to work effectively as a team and independently in a process-based environment.
   Prior experience in a hi-tech/semi-conductor implementation is a plus.
  
  Benefits: 
 
   Lattice recognizes that employees are its greatest asset and the driving force behind success in a highly competitive, global industry. Lattice continually strives to provide a comprehensive compensation and benefits program to attract, retain, motivate, reward and celebrate the highest caliber employees in the industry.
 
 
  Lattice is an international, service-driven developer of innovative low cost, low power programmable design solutions. Our global workforce, some 800 strong, shares a total commitment to customer success and an unbending will to win. For more information about how our FPGA, CPLD and programmable power management devices help our customers unlock their innovation, visit www.latticesemi.com. You can also follow us via Twitter, Facebook, or RSS. At Lattice, we value the diversity of individuals, ideas, perspectives, insights and values, and what they bring to the workplace. Applications are welcome from all qualified candidates.
 
  Lattice
  Feel the energy.

Job Summary 
 We are seeking a dynamic leader to join our growing team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for providing overall leadership to Data Analytics & Solutions Center of Excellence in the site in terms of strategy, people, processes, projects and technology. 
 In this role your responsibilities will be: 
 
  Identify new opportunities, develop, and implement strategies to expand Solutions and Value provided to Business Units. 
  Establish relationship with Emerson Business Units and maintain communication, seek feedback and drive continuous improvement of Service offerings. 
  Work closely with site Senior Leadership Team, Collaborate and Align Strategies with larger Emerson Business needs and programs. 
  Ensure that adequate resources are on boarded. Attract, hire, train, and lead a hard-working personnel resource. 
  Manage their performance cycles, identify & provide growth opportunities to people, work closely with HR and site leadership to implement development/improvement plans. 
  Provide management, ensure coordination, establish work processes across several projects within team. Perform monitoring and control of all projects for timely deliveries, quality of deliverables and budget. 
 
 Who you are: 
 You understand and balance the interests of multiple stakeholders. You relate comfortably to a wide variety of people. You follow through on commitments and ensure others do the same. 
 For This Role, You Will Need: 
 
  Minimum Bachelor of Engineering/Technology in Computer Science / Electronics / Instrumentation engineering or any equivalent degree. 
  PMP, SAFe Certifications would be preferred, And MBA degree would be an advantage. 
  Experience of delivering end-to-end multifaceted projects/solutions/products. 
  Understanding of security standards for the secure development of Industrial Automation and Control Systems would be plus. 
  Solid interpersonal skills and the ability to work cross-functionally and at different levels of the organization are important. 
  Ability to travel domestically and internationally required. 
 
 Preferred Qualifications that Set You Apart: 
 
  Total 15 plus years of industry experience in software/mobile/firmware domain. 
  Recent 8 plus years of solid experience in leading application development teams or projects and key customer accounts, of team size 25 and above. 
 
 Our offer to you: 
 By joining Emerson, you will be given the opportunity to make a difference through the work you do. 
 Emerson's compensation and benefits programs are designed to be competitive within the industry and local labor markets . We also offer a comprehensive medical and insurance coverage to meet the needs of our employees. 
 We are committed to creating a global workplace that supports diversity, equity and embraces inclusion . We welcome foreign nationals to join us through our Work Authorization Sponsorship . 
 We attract, develop, and retain exceptional people in an inclusive environment, where all employees can reach their greatest potential . We are dedicated to the ongoing development of our employees because we know that it is essential to our success as a global company. 
 We have established our Remote Work Policy for eligible roles to promote Work-Life Balance through a hybrid work set up where our team members can take advantage of working both from home and at the office. 
 Safety is paramount to us, and we are relentless in our pursuit to provide a Safe Working Environment across our global network and facilities. 
 Through our benefits, development opportunities, and an inclusive and safe work environment, we aim to create an organization our people are proud to represent.

Your Future Evolves Here
 
 
 
   Evolent Health has a bold mission to change the health of the nation by changing the way health care is delivered. Our pursuit of this mission is the driving force that brings us to work each day. We believe in embracing new ideas, challenging ourselves and failing forward. We respect and celebrate individual talents and team wins. We have fun while working hard and Evolenteers often make a difference working in everything from scrubs to jeans.
 
 
 
   Are we growing? Absolutely and Globally. In 2021 we grew our teams by almost 50% and continue to grow even more in 2022. Are we recognized as a company you are supported by for your career and growth, and a great place to work? Definitely. Evolent Health International (Pune, India) has been certified as ���������Great Places to Work��������� in 2021. In 2020 and 2021 Evolent in the U.S. was both named Best Company for Women to Advance list by Parity.org and earned a perfect score on the Huma Equality Index (CEI). This index is the nation's foremost benchmarking survey and report measuring corporate policies and practices related to LGBTQ+ workplace equality.
 
 
 
   We recognize employees that live our values, give back to our communities each year, and are champions for bringing our whole selves to work each day. If you���������re looking for a place where your work can be personally and professionally rewarding, don���������t just join a company with a mission. Join a mission with a company behind it.
 
 
 
   What You���������ll Be Doing:
 
 
 
   Position Summary
 
 
 
   The Evolent Data Operations team is currently looking for an experienced Data Analyst who possesses the ability to transform and provide supportive guidance within a team setting. This role within the team dynamic requires the candidate to exude patience, diligence, and sharp focus to meet the expectations set forth by the responsibilities of the role. This position req skills as communication is critical to success of overall team performance in addition to individual performance. On the Data Operations team, we have a great team atmosphere in which we all work collaboratively together to accomplish our goals and/or tasks. There is no ���������I��������� type of mindset within the Data Operations team; collaboration is key to Data Ops meeting established SLA/OLAs and monitoring of several enterprise SOPs. We continually strive to create a fun and fostering environment in which every team member���������s opinion, thoughts and ideas are encouraged and welcomed.
 
 
 
   The Data Analyst individual will be working with several other teams and/or departments in the following, but not limited to, capacity: (1) remediating data issues pertaining to processes which require a coordinated effort between multiple teams (2) working on developing short/long term solutions pertaining to processes which may require optimization and/sisting other teams and/or departments to help operationalize tasks (e.g. defining procedures & creating SOPs) that may require additional support not currently present (4) communicating vital information with internal and external stakeholders related to daily operational tasks and/or status of monitored processes.
 
 
 
   The Data Analyst main responsibilities will include, but are not limited to, the following: (1) managing and working directly with onshore/offshore team(s) to remediate issues related to data issues encountered on a daily basis (2) independently and/or collaboratively completing supplemental projects outside of the expected responsibilities and/or operations to optimize and contribute to the continued growth of the organization (3) working on tasks, data issues or other initiatives related to both Data Operations and Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) focus areas (4) continually working with reporting manager to accomplish larger team initiatives and contribute to the team�����d/towards meeting such initiatives/goals (5) Maintaining SLA���������s on tickets and bringing it to resolution via working with different internal teams.
 
 
 
   From a technical perspective, this position entails routinely working with tools such as, but not limited to, the following: SQL Server Management Studio/SSIS/SSRS, SAS, Microsoft suite/tools (e.g. Excel, Word, PowerShell, Outlook, Teams), File/ETL workflow applications (e.g. ETL coordination tools and MoveIT File Monitor), Atlassian products (e.g. Confluence, JIRA), Bot (RPA ��������� Robot Process Automation) application, Windows Task Scheduler and several internal built applications etc.
 
 
 
   Overall, the ideal candidate is a strong critical thinker and problem solver, detail oriented, possesses as a strong work ethic, believes in team success prior to individual success and wants to be an active participant within a fun, loving, team atmosphere. Additionally, the individual is eager to learn about new proceg current operations on a continued basis. Also, the ideal candidate continually pushes to develop their professional skill set (e.g. hard & soft skills) and has a strong analytic approach to make important business decisions regarding complex situations one may be encountered with in the work environment.
 
 
 
   Essential functions
 
 
   Monitor, Execute and Remediation of Daily Operational Processes
   
     Monitor bot automation processes to ensure end-to-end file processing is completed with high efficiency and on timely basis for client and/or internal stakeholders to best meet or exceed prescribed SLAs/OLAs measured against
     Monitor various client inbound & outbound data file extract creations and remediate job failure issues as they arise.
     Facilitate monthly manual file loading processes.
     Communicate with client facing support leads to provide real time updates regarding file loading status��������� and/or potential delays to the timeliness of loading of client data.e monthly Clinical UI refresh processes to support client and/or internal stakeholder needs for timely data pushes to end user application.
     Troubleshoot various SQL server and/or SSIS issues to ensure successful end to end processing of client data to various data marts and/or data warehouses.
     Perform data validation on various data warehouse extracts to ensure accuracy and/or integrity of data is maintained throughout the entire ETL process.
     Update, maintain, provision access and answer inquiries related to enterprise-wide inventory application of all live production interfaces.
     Remediate ETL issues and provide timely feedback and/or follow-up to internal stakeholder���������s inquiries related to MOVEit file application
   
 
 
 
   Collaborate with Internal Teams to Operationalize New and/or Optimize Existing Tasks
   
     Update operational process tickets and request status updates to processes as applicable.
     Work to establish and maintain strong relationships particularly Market Ops (client facing team), in order to maintain high expectations and output of team and organizational throughput.
     Coordinate multiteam faceted processes within Evolent business units
     
       (e.g. CMS monthly file load process ��������� requires close coordination between multiple teams (Payer Data Services, Client Analytics, Data Operations and Market Operations) in order to ensure timeliness of data loading to meet prescribed SLAs/OLAs/KPIs. This operational task is coordinated and monitored by Data Ops team)
     
     Assist with Tier 2 and Tier 3 internal support teams to remediate complex data issues and discuss optimization or migration of current operational tasks overseen by these respective teams to Data Ops for process optimization within the organization.
     Work with teams and/or other departments within the organization to complete special project requests which require building new processes, solutions, documentation etc. which may not currentld/or required to meet expectations set forth by business needs.
     Coordinate with internal development teams to identify, prioritize and implement solutions to potential bugs and/or known inefficient processes.
   
 
 
 
   Implement and Develop New or Recently Transitioned Processes
   
     Work with US based team to transition SOPs from other teams and/or departments within the organization in a timely and efficient to free up resource(s) for new business needs established by new client contract commitments and/or client implementations.
     Create process documentation in Confluence (Atlassian) application for other team members to reference for future trainings or new hire.
   
 
 
 
   Work with US based team to Complete Essential Functions and Projects
   
     Identify, analyze, and assess areas of improvement in operations overseen by Data Operations and apply process improvement and/or tools where needed (as applicable) in effort to provide functionality and/or solutions where gap or inefficient process may exist.
     
       (e.g. Develop MOVEit functionality/create MOVEit jobs where needed, create batch file scripts to apply automation to improve operations where applicable)
     
     Work with hiring manager to measure and establish goals to meet annual SLA\OLA\KPI metrics established for evaluation of overall team success and contributions made to organization throughout the year.
   
 
 
   Mandatory skill set:
 
 
   Systems Analysis/ETL Workflow Knowledge
   SQL Server Fundamentals and Advanced Skills (e.g. writing queries, utilizing SSIS, SSRS to support operations)
   Strong Critical Thinking Ability to Conduct Independent Problem Solving and Solution Design/Implementation
   Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) Related Knowledge & Expertise
 
 
 
   Good to have skill set:

   Bot Automation Knowledge
   Visual Studio Experience
 
 
 
   Eligibility Criteria
 
 
   Bachelor's degree or equivalent education (required)
   4-7 years of customer service or customer relationship (CRM) management experience (preferred)
   4-7 years minimum of experience with SQL Server Management Studio (required)
   Strong interpersonal and/or communication skills (e.g. will need to communicate with internal and external stakeholders on regular basis) (required)
   Substantial knowledge of ETL and Data Warehousing processes (required)
   Abundant knowledge of Microsoft Suite applications (e.g. Word, Excel) and their functions (required)
   Has strong ability to apply problem solving and critical thinking skills in unfamiliar and/or unknown situations to solve complex problems (required)

   4-7 years minimum of experience with Atlassian (Jira/Confluence) applications and/or similar equivalents (preferred)
   Working knowledge of the fundamental of systems analysis and different components of systems (preferred)
   Ability to execute small projects and actively participate in all phases of the project timeline (preferred)
   Ability to develop, refine and document business related SOPs with minimal oversight (preferred)

These at-home technical requirements are subject to change with any scheduled re-opening of our office locations.

 To help us level up, you will ideally have: �ata and using database query language (e.g. SQL) analysis and programming and developer tools such as Python, R , databricks in a finance or analytics field. ��������� Prior model building experience is a plus but not critical. ��������� Possesses analytical mindset and strong problem-solving skills. Attention to detail and ability to multitask. ��������� Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment and dealing with ambiguity. ��������� Possesses strong communication, interpersonal and presentation skills; and ability to engage and collaborate with multiple stakeholders across teams. ��������� Extremely proactive communicator willing to raise flags when needed and keep team members informed of ongoing risk or fraud related activities. 
  
 About the Company 
  bluCognition is an AI/ML based start-up specializing in developing data products leveraging alternative data sources and providing servicing support to our cliendustry, the company is headquartered in the US, with the delivery centre based in Pune. We build all our solutions while leveraging the latest technology stack in AI, ML and NLP combined with decades of experience in risk management at some of the largest financial services firms in the world. Our clients are some of the biggest and the most progressive names in the financial services industry. We are entering a significant growth phase and are looking for individuals with entrepreneurial mindset who wants us to join in this exciting journey.
